Name: Upper part of a female figure
Description: Upper part of a female figurine in archaic Greek style, with pendants over the brow from a headband, and three pendants worn from a chain around the neck, and one hand held to the breast, from the city of Naukratis in the Western Delta. The city was a unique Greek colony installed with the permission of the Egyptian kings in the 26th Dynasty, to channel the trade between the Nile valley and the Aegean.
